physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 23-year-old girl presented with 20/20 vision, ptosis, and hypoglobus; a recurrence was noted as a palpable nodule at the medial canthus two months later. A 19-year-old man had 20/20 visual acuity, with a CT revealing an extraconal mass. A 41-year-old man presented with 3 mm of non-axial proptosis and 2 mm of upward globe displacement. A 32-year-old woman had 20/40 right eye vision, 5 mm of right proptosis, and a relative afferent pupillary defect. A 40-year-old man had 20/20 visual acuity, 4 mm of axial proptosis, and reduced sense of smell.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In case 1, multiple recurrences occurred over time. In case 2, mild ipsilateral proptosis developed leading to further surgeries. Case 3 had recurrences noted after various orbitotomies. In case 4, progressive diplopia and proptosis worsened over time before successful treatment without recurrence. Case 5 showed no improvement with initial steroid treatment; worsening proptosis noted four months later. Case 6 had progressive symptoms of diplopia and blurriness.
